definition: to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: She wanted her husband to lick her boots all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她想要她丈夫一直對她俯首聽命。

sentences.english: They’ll still obey what the oppressing group says.
sentences.chinese: 他們仍舊會聽命於舊有的壓迫集團成員。

sentences.english: He humbled himself, becoming obedient unto death, even to the death of the cross.
sentences.chinese: 他貶抑自己，聽命至死，且死在十字架上。

sentences.english: The smaller, weaker wolves knew how to obey the wolf leader.
sentences.chinese: 弱小的狼都會聽命於頭狼。

sentences.english: The Supreme Court cannot hand down dicta and simply expect the people to obey.
sentences.chinese: 最高法院不可能指望人們對法官的裁決俯首聽命。

sentences.english: If you command wisely, youll be obeyed cheerfully.
sentences.chinese: 倘君指揮有方，人人欣然聽命。

sentences.english: Don't toe the line just as it is grotesque , left to the mercy of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要因它怪誕就俯首聽命，聽任它的擺佈。

sentences.english: Carol resigned from the company because she was tired of playing second fiddle to George.
sentences.chinese: 卡羅爾向公司辭了職，因爲她再也不願聽命於喬治。

sentences.english: An independent judiciary is one that is not subject to the whims of elected officials.
sentences.chinese: 一個獨立的司法系統不聽命於民選官員的意志。
防範不嚴的心靈便俯首聽命了。

sentences.english: Now he is subjecting Parliament to prime-ministerial whim.
sentences.chinese: 現在他強迫國會聽命於自己的率性政治。

sentences.english: The south also paid little obedience .
sentences.chinese: 南方也很不願意俯首聽命。

sentences.english: Everyone was entirely subject to the whim of the Sultan.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都完全聽命於蘇丹王，由着他隨心所欲。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
